segment.source: Windows App Certification Kit
segment.target: Windows App Certification Kit

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: To give your app the best chance of being published on the Windows Store, or becoming Windows Certified, validate and test it locally before you submit it for certification.
segment.target: To give your app the best chance of being published on the Windows Store, or becoming Windows Certified, validate and test it locally before you submit it for certification.

segment.source: This topic shows you how to install and run the Windows App Certification Kit.
segment.target: This topic shows you how to install and run the Windows App Certification Kit.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Prerequisites for testing a Universal Windows app:
segment.target: Prerequisites for testing a Universal Windows app:

segment.source: You must install and run Windows 10.
segment.target: You must install and run Windows 10.

segment.source: You must install Windows App Certification Kit version 10, which is included in the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 10.
segment.target: You must install Windows App Certification Kit version 10, which is included in the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 10.

segment.source: You must have a valid developer license for your computer.
segment.target: You must have a valid developer license for your computer.

segment.source: See Get a developer license to learn how.
segment.target: See Get a developer license to learn how.

segment.source: You must deploy the Windows app that you want to test to your computer.
segment.target: You must deploy the Windows app that you want to test to your computer.

segment.source: A note about in-place upgrades
segment.target: A note about in-place upgrades

segment.source: The installation of a more recent Windows App Certification Kit will replace any previous version of the kit that is installed on the machine.
segment.target: The installation of a more recent Windows App Certification Kit will replace any previous version of the kit that is installed on the machine.

segment.source: Validate your Windows app using the Windows App Certification Kit interactively
segment.target: Validate your Windows app using the Windows App Certification Kit interactively

segment.source: From the Start menu, search Apps, find Windows Kits, and click Windows App Cert Kit.
segment.target: From the Start menu, search Apps, find Windows Kits, and click Windows App Cert Kit.

segment.source: From the Windows App Certification Kit, select the category of validation you would like to perform.
segment.target: From the Windows App Certification Kit, select the category of validation you would like to perform.

segment.source: For example: If you are validating a Windows app, select Validate a Windows app.
segment.target: For example: If you are validating a Windows app, select Validate a Windows app.

segment.source: You may browse directly to the app you're testing, or choose the app from a list in the UI.
segment.target: You may browse directly to the app you're testing, or choose the app from a list in the UI.

segment.source: When the Windows App Certification Kit is run for the first time, the UI lists all the Windows apps that you have installed on your computer.
segment.target: When the Windows App Certification Kit is run for the first time, the UI lists all the Windows apps that you have installed on your computer.

segment.source: For any subsequent runs, the UI will display the most recent Windows apps that you have validated.
segment.target: For any subsequent runs, the UI will display the most recent Windows apps that you have validated.

segment.source: If the app that you want to test is not listed, you can click on My app isn't listed to get a comprehensive list of all apps installed on your system.
segment.target: If the app that you want to test is not listed, you can click on My app isn't listed to get a comprehensive list of all apps installed on your system.

segment.source: After you have input or selected the app that you want to test, click Next.
segment.target: After you have input or selected the app that you want to test, click Next.

segment.source: From the next screen, you will see the test workflow that aligns to the app type you are testing.
segment.target: From the next screen, you will see the test workflow that aligns to the app type you are testing.

segment.source: If a test is grayed out in the list, the test is not applicable to your environment.
segment.target: If a test is grayed out in the list, the test is not applicable to your environment.

segment.source: For example, if you are testing a Windows 10 app on Windows 7, only static tests will apply to the workflow.
segment.target: For example, if you are testing a Windows 10 app on Windows 7, only static tests will apply to the workflow.

segment.source: Note that the Windows Store may apply all tests from this workflow.
segment.target: Note that the Windows Store may apply all tests from this workflow.

segment.source: Select the tests you want to run and click Next.
segment.target: Select the tests you want to run and click Next.

segment.source: The Windows App Certification Kit begins validating the app.
segment.target: The Windows App Certification Kit begins validating the app.

segment.source: At the prompt after the test, enter the path to the folder where you want to save the test report.
segment.target: At the prompt after the test, enter the path to the folder where you want to save the test report.

segment.source: The Windows App Certification Kit creates an HTML along with an XML report and saves it in this folder.
segment.target: The Windows App Certification Kit creates an HTML along with an XML report and saves it in this folder.

segment.source: Open the report file and review the results of the test.
segment.target: Open the report file and review the results of the test.

segment.source: Note If you're using Visual Studio, you can run the Windows App Certification Kit when you create your app package.
segment.target: Note If you're using Visual Studio, you can run the Windows App Certification Kit when you create your app package.

segment.source: See Packaging UWP apps to learn how.
segment.target: See Packaging UWP apps to learn how.

segment.source: Validate your Windows app using the Windows App Certification Kit from a command line
segment.target: Validate your Windows app using the Windows App Certification Kit from a command line

segment.source: Important The Windows App Certification Kit must be run within the context of an active user session.
segment.target: Important The Windows App Certification Kit must be run within the context of an active user session.

segment.source: In the command window, navigate to the directory that contains the Windows App Certification Kit.
segment.target: In the command window, navigate to the directory that contains the Windows App Certification Kit.

segment.source: Note The default path is C:\\Program Files\\Windows Kits\\10\\App Certification Kit\\.
segment.target: Note The default path is C:\\Program Files\\Windows Kits\\10\\App Certification Kit\\.

segment.source: Enter the following commands in this order to test an app that is already installed on your test computer:
segment.target: Enter the following commands in this order to test an app that is already installed on your test computer:

segment.source: Or you can use the following commands if the app is not installed.
segment.target: Or you can use the following commands if the app is not installed.

segment.source: The Windows App Certification Kit will open the package and apply the appropriate test workflow:
segment.target: The Windows App Certification Kit will open the package and apply the appropriate test workflow:

segment.source: After the test completes, open the report file named and review the test results.
segment.target: After the test completes, open the report file named and review the test results.

segment.source: Note The Windows App Certification Kit can be run from a service, but the service must initiate the kit process within an active user session and cannot be run in Session0.
segment.target: Note The Windows App Certification Kit can be run from a service, but the service must initiate the kit process within an active user session and cannot be run in Session0.

segment.source: Note For more info about the Windows App Certification Kit command line, enter the command
segment.target: Note For more info about the Windows App Certification Kit command line, enter the command

segment.source: Testing with a low-power computer
segment.target: Testing with a low-power computer

segment.source: The performance test thresholds of the Windows App Certification Kit are based on the performance of a low-power computer.
segment.target: The performance test thresholds of the Windows App Certification Kit are based on the performance of a low-power computer.

segment.source: The characteristics of the computer on which the test is performed can influence the test results.
segment.target: The characteristics of the computer on which the test is performed can influence the test results.

segment.source: To determine if your app’s performance meets the Windows Store Policies, we recommend that you test your app on a low-power computer, such as an Intel Atom processor-based computer with a screen resolution of 1366x768 (or higher) and a rotational hard drive (as opposed to a solid-state hard drive).
segment.target: To determine if your app’s performance meets the Windows Store Policies, we recommend that you test your app on a low-power computer, such as an Intel Atom processor-based computer with a screen resolution of 1366x768 (or higher) and a rotational hard drive (as opposed to a solid-state hard drive).

segment.source: As low-power computers evolve, their performance characteristics might change over time.
segment.target: As low-power computers evolve, their performance characteristics might change over time.

segment.source: Refer to the most current Windows Store Policies and test your app with the most current version of the Windows App Certification Kit to make sure that your app complies with the latest performance requirements.
segment.target: Refer to the most current Windows Store Policies and test your app with the most current version of the Windows App Certification Kit to make sure that your app complies with the latest performance requirements.
